item.title: Dark Fiber for Bandwidth and Security
item.description:
Upgrading from copper to fiber optics is a significant step for many businesses, but for some, it’s simply not enough. When even the highest capacity fiber optic services lack the necessary bandwidth or security features, dark fiber emerges as the solution. One might wonder how lit fiber services could be insufficient, considering they offer speeds up to 10,000 Mbps (10 Gigabit SONET or Ethernet) and, in some cases, even up to 40 Gbps (OC-768)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dark-fiber-for-bandwidth-and-security/

item.title: Medical Records Head To The Cloud
item.description:
The medical field is transitioning to electronic records to control rising costs. Verizon is at the forefront of this shift with its cloud-based service, Verizon Health Information Exchange. This service provides a platform for storing patient records in a standardized format, enabling healthcare providers to share information seamlessly via web-based access. Verizon’s entry into this domain could lead to the establishment of industry standards for electronic medical records, much like IBM did for personal computers...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/medical-records-head-to-the-cloud/
